dialog: Pray tell, where might I find the Apparition point for New York?
You must first check in at Counter No. 4.
Is that the one yonder?
Indeed, then follow the signage to Platform 85.
My thanks. You have been most helpful.
Mr. Crandall, I regret to say that I cannot fathom the reasoning behind starting this project anew. 'Twill require a great deal of effort.
That is quite true. But such is the nature of our profession, Maria. There can be no question that the current project is unacceptable.
I concur. Yet, I believe that a few modifications could remedy the situation. Might I have the chance to prove myself?
Very well, Maria. I shall grant you until the hour of four tomorrow to produce satisfactory results, else you shall have to repeat the endeavor.
I believe 'tis time to confront my admirer and set him to rights.
Is that so? How do you plan to make contact?
I shall leave him a message, affixed to my workstation.
What does it say? Do you anticipate that he shall read it?
He shall. It states, 'I have a sweet tooth. Meet me at half past two in the carriage park.'
Might I observe from the window?
Nay, I shall keep you abreast of the situation later. At present, I must locate Vince.
There is still much left. Would you care for another serving?
Aye, I should like that. 'Tis quite delicious.
Pardon me, does this Knight Bus travel to the new shop of books?
Nay, you must disembark at the bank and take the No. 50.
